comments:
When using the Eclipse project copy operation on a J2EE project (web, ejb, ear), the copied project's deployment descriptor model is not being properly set up.  In the J2EE perspective Project Explorer view, the copied project's deployment descriptor element doesn't show up.  Also, any validators which access the deployment descriptor fail.  For example, on a copied web project, the validator fails with 
CHKJ3000E: WAR Validation Failed: error.org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.commonarchivecore.internal.exception.DeploymentDescriptorLoadException: WEB-INF/web.xml

Can recreate in the project explorer using the Copy / Paste project actions, and   can also recreate programmatically through IResource.copy().

Closing and re-opening the project causes the deployment descriptor model to properly show up.  Validation can then be forced (doesn't automatically occur) by touching the deployment descriptor, in order to remove the validation errors caused by absence of the descriptor.

Created an attachment (id=46946)
Corrects the nature_registration for ModuleCoreNature


When the project is c&p'd, the Project Resource Set is not properly configured before the resource change listeners are notified. This results in resources being created before the resource factories are configured properly, which results in load difficulties later on. 

This patch corrects the nature_registration extension so that the ModuleCoreNature will have an opportunity to contribute to the EMFWorkbenchContext (and thus configure the URI converters and Resource Factories properly before any resources are created).
John -- would you review and release this patch. Thanks.
This is released for the WTP 1.5.1 builds for 073006.

From testing under WTP M-1.5.1-200608110237, there are still problems copying a J2EE project, regarding loss of the deployment descriptor, however now the deployment descriptor from the original project is adversely affected instead of the copy.  After the copy / paste operation, the project copy has a proper deployment descriptor, but the original project's deployment descriptor either disappears from the Project Explorer view, or if it is present, attempting to open it for editing results in the following:
- the editor comes up with the descriptor marked with the "changed" asterisk (even though no changes have been made through the editor)
- saving the descriptor from the editor results in an org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.commonarchivecore.internal.exception being logged
- closing the editor without saving the descriptor results in other exceptions being logged, and the descriptor no longer appears in the Project Explorer view. For an EJB project, the following exceptions occur:
---------------------

This is a duplicate of 152493.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 152493 ***

The exceptions appear to be gone (defect 152493), but the descriptor from the original project is still being overwritten with an empty descriptor.  Tried this out on the 20060824 1.5.1 maintenance WTP build.

To recreate:
- Create a web or ejb project
- From the J2EE perspective project explorer, do a copy of the project followed by a paste.
- The project copy has a valid (web or ejb) descriptor that shows up in the project explorer view.  The original copied project however has its descriptor overwritten with the following (empty descriptor) content:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

The copied project's descriptor does not show up in the project explorer.  If you browse to the underlying descriptor file and bring it up in the editor, it comes up with the editing changed indicator '*', and its content has been wiped out (just has the xml header element listed above).

Retried on WTP M-1.5.1-20060831 2130, using Eclipse M20060830-0800.  Previous trial was on a version of Eclipse that may not have had required fixes for this problem.  However, problem is still occurring (as documented in previous post) on this later build.

This is still a duplicate of eclipse bug 152493.  I have reopened it as it was not tagged for the 3.2.1 eclipse stream.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 152493 ***
